node.title: Cardi B Closed Out Art Basel Parties
node.description: And Chanel held a dinner in an art forest.

node.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘I Felt Desire Overshadow Fear’
node.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

node.title: The Jets and Giants Played. They Did Not Win.
node.description: Neither team won on Sunday, with the Jets falling to the Philadelphia Eagles’ backup quarterback and the Giants’ offense scuffling against the renewed Miami Dolphins.

node.title: How Can Something Be Racist but Not Racist at the Same Time?
node.description: These days, it’s hard to tell.

node.title: Sex Toy Ads Lead Some U.S., Japan Broadcasters to Cancel Livestream of Curling Tournament
node.description: No products were on the ice and the sponsor has a non-explicit logo, but organizers were told the sponsorship would be inappropriate for American audiences.

node.title: Nigerians Distributing COVID Vaccines Often Doing So Without Pay, Risk of Gang Kidnapping
node.description: Health care clinics are delivering vaccinations to villagers who do not have access to the vaccine, risking their lives on routes known for gang activity.

node.title: Use of Blood Plasma From COVID Survivors in Current Patients Has 'No Clear Benefit': WHO
node.description: The WHO said that recent evidence "shows that convalescent plasma does not improve survival or reduce the need for mechanical ventilation."

node.title: Brian Kemp-Backed Group Targets 'Crooked Insider' David Perdue in Georgia Governor's Race
node.description: Former President Donald Trump endorsed Perdue in a statement Monday night that also criticized Kemp's stance on "election integrity."

node.title: Viral Video Shows Fast Food Workers Fighting Back Against Man Who Jumped Behind Counter
node.description: "No one gets paid enough for this sh*t," the caption of the video read.

node.title: In Victory for Putin, Congress Drops Sanctions From Proposed Defense Bill
node.description: The updated version of the proposed spending bill came on the same day President Biden met virtually with Russia President Vladimir Putin.

node.title: Seattle's Kshama Sawant Subject of Recall That Could Be Litmus Test for Liberal City
node.description: Seattle's longest-tenured city council member is facing recall for accusations including leading protestors to the mayor's house and a financial violation.

node.title: Grieving father urges young drivers to 'be the change you want to see on the road'
node.description: As a grief-stricken family prepares for their first Christmas since their teenage son was killed in a car crash, Queensland is at risk of recording its highest road toll since 2009 as authorities brace for a busy holiday season when the border opens.

node.title: Nearly 25 years after an appalling murder, this couple is keeping a promise from a world away
node.description: After Japanese student Michiko Okuyama was killed in Cairns in 1997, Luiza and John Grave promised her family they would maintain her memorial garden. A quarter of a century later, they're still as good as their word.

node.title: Canberra family unknowingly buys asbestos-filled home for $1.8 million
node.description: Dean Papas, a builder, knew well the ACT's dark history of "Mr Fluffy" housing, but must now watch his new home be demolished.

node.title: Marie-Claire Blais, Acclaimed French Canadian Novelist, Dies at 82
node.description: Though largely unknown outside Canada, she was often ranked alongside Margaret Atwood and Alice Munro as one of the country’s greatest living writers.

node.title: 'Gotta Love Costco': TikToker Claims She Earns $29.50 to Draw Smiley Faces on Receipts
node.description: "My resume is about to say, masters in symmetrical smiley faces," a commenter wrote under the viral TikTok.

node.title: On the Banks of the Furious Congo River, a 5-Star Emporium of Ambition
node.description: As the clean energy revolution upends the centuries-long lock of fossil fuels on the global economy, dealmakers and hustlers converge on the Fleuve Congo Hotel.

node.title: The U.S. surgeon general warns of a mental health crisis among young people, worsened by the pandemic.
node.description: The message came as part of a rare public advisory from the nation’s top physician, Dr. Vivek H. Murthy.

node.title: South Africa Safari Businesses Suffered Big in 2020, Then Saw Improvement – Until Omicron
node.description: South Africa's safari businesses were seeing increased 2022 bookings, but the Omicron variant's spread has caused many foreign tourists to cancel.

node.title: Chris Cuomo's Book Pulled by Publisher After CNN Firing
node.description: Cuomo's book "Deep Denial" was set to be published by HarperCollins in fall 2022.

node.title: Two years after a protected species was found in remote bushland, the patch of land was listed for logging
node.description: When 19 greater gliders were found in 2018, environmentalists thought their patch of forest would be protected. They are baffled by what has happened since, and fear the area will soon be logged.

node.title: Finding you're a bit COVID-19 anxious ahead of Tasmania's border reopening? These tips may help
node.description: Life in Tasmania has been relatively normal and lockdown-free this year, so it's no wonder some people are feeling a little anxious about the state's border reopening in a week's time. So what can you do to ease the concern?

node.title: 'Ask me about my missing colon': Life, health and dating with ulcerative colitis
node.description: Amelia shares her experience of living with severe ulcerative colitis and how she's found being open about her condition has helped her get back to living her best life. A sense of humour helps too.

node.title: 'It's confusing for parents': NSW Premier says it makes sense for states to run childcare
node.description: Dominic Perrottet will today call for a dramatic overhaul of the way the national childcare system is run, handing responsibility over from the Commonwealth to the states.

node.title: Is Bellerive really on the nose? It's just not cricket
node.description: With Hobart now forced into a race to secure the fifth Ashes Test against mainland rivals, Chris Rowbottom asks why it wasn't awarded outright — is the game in such brittle condition that playing one Ashes test in Tasmania will see it crumble?

node.title: 'My mental health struggles have no connection with my worth as a Muslim'
node.description: When Lina faced mental health problems, she says some in her community told her she "wasn't praying enough", and was an "ungrateful, un-Islamic person". She wants that to change.

node.title: When fear and misinformation struck this Pacific community, their youth took a stand
node.description: When vaccine anxiety swept through Australia's diverse communities, local "heroes" were on-call to offer support. Meet the volunteers who helped overcome "panic and anxiety" during COVID-19.

node.title: On the upside the drought map is finally clear. On the downside more flooding is expected this week
node.description: More rain and renewed flooding are expected for the east this week as many catchments are already at capacity.

node.title: Investor loses $700,000 in overseas scam
node.description: An Aucklander's massive loss in a scam has prompted a warning from the financial regulator, which is urging people to look for red flags.
